executive_summary: Somnath Kshirsagar is a 43-year-old male with Type 1 Diabetes Mellitus (T1DM) diagnosed in 2021. His current HbA1c is 8.3%, which is above the target, indicating a need for improved glycemic control and lifestyle modifications.

clinical_context.recent_events: No recent severe hypoglycemic events or DKA reported.

labs_table.comment: Above target, indicating poor glycemic control.

interpretation.assessment: Current HbA1c is above the target for T1DM.
interpretation.plan: Consider medication adjustments and lifestyle interventions.

interpretation.assessment: Significantly above the target, indicating high cardiovascular risk.
interpretation.plan: Initiate statin therapy and dietary modifications.
Monitor renal function and consider ACE inhibitor therapy.

lifestyle_plan.text: Increase physical activity to at least 150 minutes of moderate exercise per week.
Limit alcohol intake to no more than 14 units per week.

diet_plan.principles: Adopt a balanced diet rich in whole grains, fruits, vegetables, and lean proteins while reducing saturated fats and sugars.
sample_meals: Breakfast: Oatmeal with berries and a small handful of nuts.
Lunch: Grilled chicken salad with a variety of vegetables and olive oil dressing.
Dinner: Baked fish with quinoa and steamed broccoli.
diet_plan.portion_guidance: Use the plate method: half of the plate for vegetables, a quarter for protein, and a quarter for carbohydrates.

monitoring_plan.glucose_targets: Aim for pre-meal glucose levels of 4-7 mmol/L and post-meal levels below 8.5 mmol/L.
monitoring_plan.testing_frequency: Test blood glucose at least 4 times a day.
monitoring_plan.safety_checks: Regularly check for signs of hypoglycemia and ketones.

patient_goals: Reduce LDL cholesterol to < 2.0 mmol/L within 3 months.
Engage in at least 150 minutes of physical activity weekly.

medication_plan.text: Consider starting a statin for LDL management.
Consider starting an ACE inhibitor for renal protection.

follow_up.actions: Reassess HbA1c, lipid profile, and renal function.

emr_note: Patient with T1DM presents with HbA1c of 8.3%, elevated LDL, and mild albuminuria. Lifestyle modifications and medication adjustments recommended.
